member.name: T:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.JoinedModuleDbContext
member.summary:
The DbContext to use when the entity being returned references entities in this module that have Navigation properties that cross over to other Logical Modules (and therefore Schemas).
Note that this DbContext's constructor is Dependency Injected with DbContexts it references.

member.name: M:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.JoinedModuleDbContext.#ctor(App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.ModuleDbContext,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,App.Modules.Core.Infrastructure.Services.IAppDbContextManagementService)
member.summary:
Invoked by Constructor.
This is the constructor invoked by the system's dependency injector/creator.
member.param: The application database context management service.

member.name: M:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.JoinedModuleDbContext.OnConfiguring(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptionsBuilder)
member.summary: Note: default behaviour is that it is not called by constructor by default. But is called by Migrate.

member.name: T:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.ModuleDbContext
member.summary:
This Module's specific .
Note that it doesn't do much beyond reusing base functionality within which ensures the name of the DbContext is specific to the Module Name (eg: 'Core' + 'DbContext' = 'CoreDbContext') and that it searches for implementations of
to create this Module's Database, and the searches for to seed the database if and as required.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.ModuleDbContext.#ctor(Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration,App.Modules.Core.Infrastructure.Services.IAppDbContextManagementService)
member.summary: This is the constructor invoked by the system's dependency injector/creator.

summary.para: Note: Whereas the other constructors are invoked during run time, this constructor will be called by the , which is invoked when the 'dotnet ef' commands are issued from the command line (eg, for Migrations).

member.name: M:App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.ModuleDbContext.#ctor(Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContextOptions{App.Modules.KWMODULE.Infrastructure.Data.Db.Contexts.ModuleDbContext})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.para: Note: The override is not strictly required -- it's just here to bring attention to the work being done in the base class.
Note: The override is not strictly required -- it's just here to bring attention to the work being done in the base class.
Note that each logical Module requires it's own ModuleDbContext.
